issues.name: No services listed
issues.what_we_found: Your Google Business Profile has no services listed in the Services section.
issues.why_it_matters: Sterling Sky 2022 retest confirmed that adding services has direct ranking impact. Effects appear within 24-72 hours. Pre-defined services (suggested by Google) have stronger ranking impact than custom services. This is one of the highest-impact quick wins available.
how_to_fix: Go to Google Search and type 'my business'
Click 'Edit Services' in your dashboard
Check ALL pre-defined services Google suggests for your categories
Add custom services for anything not covered by pre-defined options
Write a brief description (up to 300 characters) for each service
Include service keywords naturally in descriptions

issues.name: Few services listed
issues.what_we_found: Your profile has only {services_count} services listed. Most optimized profiles have 10-15+ services.
issues.why_it_matters: Each service you add creates another relevance signal for Google. Sterling Sky testing shows pre-defined services have direct ranking impact. You're leaving ranking opportunities on the table.
how_to_fix: Go to Edit Services in your GBP dashboard
Review all pre-defined services Google suggests
Add every relevant service your business offers
Write 300-character descriptions for each service
Think about every service variation a customer might search for

issues.name: No business description
issues.what_we_found: Your Google Business Profile has no business description. You have 750 characters to tell Google and customers what you do.
issues.why_it_matters: While description doesn't directly impact rankings (per Sterling Sky testing), it significantly affects engagement and conversions. It's also the primary text Google uses to understand your business for AI search results.
how_to_fix: Go to Google Search, type 'my business'
Click 'Edit Profile' then navigate to the About tab
Write a 500-750 character description
Include your primary service and city in the first 100 characters
Mention your key services, unique value, and service area
Do NOT keyword stuff. Write naturally.

issues.name: Short description
issues.what_we_found: Your business description is only {description_length} characters. You have room for up to 750 characters.
issues.why_it_matters: A longer, more detailed description gives Google more context about your business. It also helps potential customers understand your full range of services before they contact you.
how_to_fix: Expand your description to 500-750 characters
Add details about your specific services
Mention your service area or neighborhood
Include what makes your business different
Add a call to action at the end

issues.name: Description missing city name
issues.what_we_found: Your business description does not mention your city ({city_name}). Including your location helps Google connect your business to local searches.
issues.why_it_matters: While not a direct ranking factor, mentioning your city in the description reinforces geographic relevance. For AI search platforms, this helps connect your business to location-based queries.
how_to_fix: Edit your description to naturally include your city name
Ideally place it in the first 100 characters
Example: '[Business] is a [service] provider in [city]'

issues.name: No secondary categories
issues.what_we_found: Your profile has no secondary categories. You can add up to 9 secondary categories to expand your search visibility.
issues.why_it_matters: Joy Hawkins confirmed that more relevant categories help rankings, they do not dilute them. Each secondary category allows your business to appear in additional search queries. Most optimized profiles use 3-5 secondary categories.
how_to_fix: Go to Edit Profile in your GBP dashboard
Navigate to the category section
Add 3-5 secondary categories relevant to your services
Use GMB Everywhere or PlePer to see what categories competitors use
Only add categories for services you genuinely offer

issues.name: Only 1-2 secondary categories
issues.what_we_found: Your profile has only {secondary_categories_count} secondary categories. You can add up to 9.
issues.why_it_matters: Additional relevant categories expand the search queries where your business appears. Your competitors may have more categories, giving them visibility for searches you're missing.
how_to_fix: Research what additional categories your competitors use
Add any relevant categories you're missing
Target 3-5 total secondary categories

issues.name: Primary category may be suboptimal
issues.what_we_found: Your primary category '{primary_category}' differs from what your top competitors use. Most competitors in your area use '{competitor_common_category}'.
issues.why_it_matters: Whitespark 2026: Primary category is the #1 controllable local pack ranking factor. 84% of top-3 ranking businesses had categories closely matching competitors (BrightLocal). A single category change caused a documented drop from #1 to #31 (Joy Hawkins).
how_to_fix: Research competitor categories using GMB Everywhere or PlePer
Record your current rankings as a baseline
Test switching to the competitor-matching category
Monitor rankings for 60-90 days
If rankings improve, keep the new category
If rankings drop, switch back immediately

issues.name: Hours not set
issues.what_we_found: Your business hours are not set on your Google Business Profile.
issues.why_it_matters: Joy Hawkins discovered that business hours are a top-5 ranking factor (November 2023 core update). Businesses without hours set are at a significant disadvantage. Google may show you as 'Hours not available' which reduces customer trust.
how_to_fix: Go to Edit Profile in your GBP dashboard
Navigate to Hours section
Set accurate hours for each day of the week
Consider extending hours if possible (opens more search visibility)
Set special hours for upcoming holidays

issues.name: Limited business hours
issues.what_we_found: Your business is open an average of {average_daily_hours} hours per day. This limits when you appear in search results.
issues.why_it_matters: Joy Hawkins: Businesses vanish from the local pack when closed. Rankings begin degrading in the final hour of operation. Longer hours = more visibility windows throughout the day.
how_to_fix: Evaluate if you can extend hours (even by 1-2 hours)
Check what hours your competitors list
Consider opening when competitors are closed (evenings, weekends)
For service businesses: consider hiring an answering service for extended hours

issues.name: Closed on weekends while competitors are open
issues.what_we_found: Your business is closed on weekends, but {competitors_open_count} of your top 3 competitors are open.
issues.why_it_matters: Weekend searches are high-intent. If you're closed and competitors are open, Google shows them instead of you. You're missing prime search visibility.
how_to_fix: Consider opening at least Saturday (even limited hours)
If not possible, ensure your website captures weekend searchers
Update special hours for any weekend availability

issues.name: Missing common attributes
issues.what_we_found: Your profile is missing several attributes that are common for your business category.
issues.why_it_matters: Whitespark 2026 ranks attributes as low-moderate impact. They build trust and help customers make decisions. Completed attributes signal a well-maintained profile to Google.
how_to_fix: Go to Edit Profile, then More section
Complete all applicable attributes (accessibility, amenities, payments, service options)
Remove any contradictory attributes
Review what attributes competitors have set

issues.name: No website linked
issues.what_we_found: Your Google Business Profile has no website linked.
issues.why_it_matters: Whitespark 2026 ranks 'Dedicated Page for Each Service on Website' as the #1 factor for local organic rankings and #2 for AI visibility. Without a website, you're missing the second-largest ranking factor category (18% of total ranking signals).
how_to_fix: Build a basic website with at least 5 pages: Home, Services, About, Contact, Service Area
Include your full NAP (name, address, phone) on every page
Add LocalBusiness schema markup
Embed a Google Map on your contact page
Link the website to your GBP under Contact Information
issues.time_to_results: 2-4 weeks for indexing, 1-3 months for ranking impact

issues.name: Under 10 total reviews
issues.what_we_found: Your profile has only {review_count} reviews. This is below the minimum threshold for competitive visibility.
issues.why_it_matters: Search Atlas ML Study: Review count is 19.2% of ranking variance for all positions, and 26% for top 10 positions. Businesses with fewer than 10 reviews struggle to appear in the local pack for competitive searches.
how_to_fix: Start asking every satisfied customer for a review
Send a direct Google review link (find it in your GBP dashboard under 'Ask for reviews')
Ask within 24-48 hours of a positive interaction
Follow up once after 3-5 days if no review
Consider QR codes at your location pointing to the review link
Target: 1-3 new reviews per week consistently
issues.time_to_results: 2-6 weeks for ranking impact as reviews accumulate

issues.name: Fewer reviews than competitors
issues.what_we_found: You have {review_count} reviews. Your top 3 competitors average {competitor_average_reviews} reviews. You're {review_gap} reviews behind.
issues.why_it_matters: Search Atlas ML Study: Review count becomes the primary battleground once proximity is competitive. At 26% influence for top 10 positions, closing the review gap is essential for ranking improvement.
how_to_fix: Calculate your monthly review target: competitor average divided by their business age
Match competitor velocity plus 1 extra review per month
Implement a consistent review generation system
Never request reviews in bursts. Steady flow is key.
Train staff to ask for reviews at point of service

issues.name: No review in 30+ days
issues.what_we_found: Your most recent review is {days_since_last_review} days old. You have not received a review in over a month.
issues.why_it_matters: Darren Shaw (Whitespark 2026): Review recency moved from #20 to a top-5 ranking factor. His exact words: 'The moment you stop getting new reviews, you're going to see your local rankings start to slip.' This is actively hurting your rankings right now.
how_to_fix: Send review requests to your 5 most recent satisfied customers today
Set up a weekly review request process
Use a direct review link to reduce friction
Consider review automation tools (Podium, Birdeye, Whitespark)
Target: at least 1 new review per week minimum
issues.time_to_fix: 15 minutes to send requests, ongoing to maintain
issues.time_to_results: Immediate once new reviews start arriving

issues.name: Low review velocity
issues.what_we_found: You're averaging less than 1 review per month. This velocity is too low to maintain or improve rankings.
issues.why_it_matters: Whitespark 2026 recommends matching competitor velocity plus 1. Consistent, ongoing review generation is a top-5 ranking factor. Sporadic bursts are less effective than steady flow.
how_to_fix: Implement a systematic review request process
Ask every customer, not just happy ones
Timing matters: ask within 24-48 hours of positive interaction
Send one polite reminder after 3-5 days if no review
Target: 2-4 reviews per month minimum

issues.name: No review responses from owner
issues.what_we_found: You have not responded to any of your {review_count} reviews.
issues.why_it_matters: Harvard Business Review: Businesses that reply to reviews receive 12% more reviews. While review responses have low-moderate direct ranking impact, they significantly affect customer perception and conversion. Responding shows you're active and care about customers.
how_to_fix: Start responding to your most recent reviews first
Use customer's first name in each response
Reference the specific service they mentioned
Keep responses under 80 words
For negative reviews: acknowledge, empathize, offer offline resolution
Target: respond to all reviews within 24-48 hours going forward
issues.time_to_fix: 1-2 hours to clear backlog, then 5 minutes per new review

issues.name: Low response rate
issues.what_we_found: You've responded to only {response_rate}% of your reviews. Best practice is 80% or higher.
issues.why_it_matters: Consistent review responses signal an active, engaged business. Businesses with high response rates receive more reviews and convert more profile visitors into customers.
how_to_fix: Set aside 10 minutes daily to check and respond to reviews
Respond to unanswered reviews in batches over the next week
Vary your responses so they don't look copy-pasted
Target: 80%+ response rate

issues.name: Rating below 4.0
issues.what_we_found: Your average rating is {average_rating} stars. This is below the 4.0 threshold that most customers consider acceptable.
issues.why_it_matters: Search Atlas ML Study: Ratings account for 3.8% of ranking variance. More importantly, customers filter search results by rating. Below 4.0, you lose significant click-through from search results.
how_to_fix: Respond professionally to all negative reviews
Identify and fix recurring service complaints
Increase review volume from satisfied customers to dilute negative reviews
Never ask customers to change or delete reviews
Focus on service quality improvement
issues.time_to_results: Gradual as new positive reviews accumulate

issues.name: Under 5 photos
issues.what_we_found: Your profile has only {photo_count} photos. This is well below the recommended minimum of 20-50.
issues.why_it_matters: Whitespark 2026: Photo quantity and quality is ranked #8 in local pack factors. Photos are a moderate ranking signal and a major engagement signal. Profiles with more photos get more clicks and customer actions.
how_to_fix: Upload at least 20 photos immediately
Include: exterior (3-5), interior (5-10), team (3-5), products/services (5-10)
Use real photos, not stock images
Ensure photos are well-lit and in focus
Add new photos monthly to show freshness
Note: Geotagging photos does NOT help rankings (Sterling Sky tested)

issues.name: Under 20 photos
issues.what_we_found: Your profile has {photo_count} photos. Optimized profiles typically have 50+ photos.
issues.why_it_matters: More photos give customers a better picture of your business. Google values photo quantity as an engagement signal. Profiles with 50+ photos tend to get more customer interactions.
how_to_fix: Add photos across all categories: exterior, interior, team, products, action shots
Target reaching 50+ total photos
Upload 5-10 new photos each month
Ask customers to upload photos too (user-generated content helps)

issues.name: No logo uploaded
issues.what_we_found: Your profile does not have a logo uploaded.
issues.why_it_matters: The logo appears in search results, Maps, and your GBP listing. Missing logo makes your business look unprofessional and reduces brand recognition.
how_to_fix: Upload your business logo in square format
Recommended: 720x720 pixels, PNG or JPG
Keep it simple and recognizable at small sizes

issues.name: No cover photo
issues.what_we_found: Your profile does not have a cover photo set.
issues.why_it_matters: The cover photo is the primary visual when someone views your GBP listing. Without it, Google selects a photo automatically, which may not represent your business well.
how_to_fix: Choose your best exterior or interior photo as cover
Recommended: 1080x608 pixels (16:9 ratio)
Should clearly represent your business
Avoid text-heavy images

issues.name: No posts visible
issues.what_we_found: Your profile has no visible posts or updates.
issues.why_it_matters: Sterling Sky testing shows posts don't directly boost rankings. But posts appear prominently in your listing, demonstrate business activity, and improve customer engagement. Google promotes active profiles.
how_to_fix: Start posting weekly updates on your GBP
Share: promotions, new services, tips, customer highlights, events
Include a photo with every post
Add a call-to-action button (Call, Book, Learn More)
Keep posts 150-300 words

issues.name: No post in 30+ days
issues.what_we_found: Your last post was {days_since_last_post} days ago. Your profile appears inactive.
issues.why_it_matters: While posts don't directly boost rankings (Sterling Sky), an inactive profile signals to customers that the business may not be actively operating. Competitors who post regularly will have more engaging listings.
how_to_fix: Publish a post today
Set a weekly posting schedule
Use a content calendar to plan posts in advance
Batch-create posts for the month in one sitting

issues.name: No website linked to GBP
issues.what_we_found: No website is linked to your Google Business Profile.
issues.why_it_matters: Whitespark 2026: Website/On-Page factors account for 18% of local pack ranking signals. 'Dedicated Page for Each Service' is the #1 factor for local organic rankings. Without a website, you're missing the largest category of optimizable ranking signals after GBP itself.
how_to_fix: Build a basic website with these essential pages:
Homepage with your NAP, primary service, and city
Individual service pages for each service you offer
About page with your story and team
Contact page with embedded Google Map and click-to-call phone
Service area page listing all areas you serve
Add LocalBusiness schema markup to every page
Once live, add the URL to your GBP under Contact Information
issues.time_to_results: 2-4 weeks for indexing, 1-3 months for ranking impact

issues.name: Website not HTTPS
issues.what_we_found: Your website does not use HTTPS. It loads on HTTP which browsers flag as 'Not Secure'.
issues.why_it_matters: Google has used HTTPS as a ranking signal since 2014. Browsers show warning messages on HTTP sites, which scares away customers. HTTPS is a basic trust signal.
how_to_fix: Install an SSL certificate on your website
Most hosting providers offer free SSL (Let's Encrypt)
Redirect all HTTP URLs to HTTPS
Update your GBP website link to use https://
issues.time_to_results: Immediate for trust, 2-4 weeks for ranking

issues.name: Website not loading
issues.what_we_found: The website linked to your GBP ({website_url}) is not loading. It returns an error or times out.
issues.why_it_matters: A broken website link on your GBP is worse than no website at all. It signals an abandoned or unreliable business. Google cannot crawl your site for ranking signals. Customers who click will leave immediately.
how_to_fix: Check if your domain registration has expired
Check if your hosting is active and paid
Contact your hosting provider to resolve the issue
If the website is permanently down, remove the link from GBP until fixed
Consider building a new website if the old one is abandoned

issues.name: Website not mobile responsive
issues.what_we_found: Your website is not mobile responsive. It does not adapt properly to mobile screens.
issues.why_it_matters: Google uses mobile-first indexing. Over 60% of local searches happen on mobile devices. A non-responsive website hurts both rankings and customer experience.
how_to_fix: If using a website builder: switch to a mobile-responsive template
If custom built: add responsive CSS or rebuild with a modern framework
Test with Google's Mobile-Friendly Test: search.google.com/test/mobile-friendly
Priority: ensure phone number is click-to-call on mobile
issues.time_to_fix: Hours to days depending on current site

issues.name: No NAP on homepage
issues.what_we_found: Your website homepage does not show your full business name, address, and phone number (NAP).
issues.why_it_matters: NAP consistency between your GBP and website is a core trust signal. Google compares the NAP on your website with your GBP listing. Mismatches or missing NAP weaken your citation/trust signals (13% of ranking factors).
how_to_fix: Add your full NAP to your website footer (appears on every page)
Format it exactly as it appears on your GBP listing
Make the phone number click-to-call
Add the same NAP in structured data (LocalBusiness schema)

issues.name: Major review gap vs. competitors
issues.what_we_found: You have {review_count} reviews. Your top 3 competitors average {competitor_average_reviews}. That's a gap of {review_gap} reviews.
issues.why_it_matters: Search Atlas ML Study: For top 10 positions, review count influences 26% of ranking variance. A significant review gap means competitors have a major advantage that grows every month they maintain higher velocity.
how_to_fix: Calculate your target monthly velocity: competitor average / their estimated months in business
Beat that velocity by at least 1 review per month
Implement systematic review requests for every customer
Consider review generation tools to automate the process
Timeline to close the gap: {estimated_months_to_close} months at recommended velocity

issues.name: Rating below market average
issues.what_we_found: Your rating ({average_rating}) is below the competitor average ({competitor_average_rating}).
issues.why_it_matters: While rating has lower ranking impact than count or recency (3.8% per Search Atlas ML), customers visually compare ratings in search results. Lower ratings reduce click-through rate.
how_to_fix: Focus on service quality to earn genuine high ratings
Respond professionally to all negative reviews
Increase review volume from satisfied customers
Do NOT incentivize 5-star reviews (Google guideline violation)

issues.name: Photo gap vs. competitors
issues.what_we_found: You have {photo_count} photos. Your competitors average {competitor_average_photos}. You need {photo_gap} more photos to match them.
issues.why_it_matters: Photos are a moderate ranking signal (Whitespark 2026 #8 factor) and a strong engagement signal. More photos give your listing more visual content for customers browsing.
how_to_fix: Upload {photo_gap} additional photos to match competitors
Focus on variety: exterior, interior, team, products, action shots
Add new photos monthly to maintain freshness
Ask satisfied customers to upload photos too

issues.name: Competitors post more frequently
issues.what_we_found: Your competitors post more frequently than you. They average {competitor_post_frequency} while you post {user_post_frequency}.
issues.why_it_matters: While posts don't directly boost rankings (Sterling Sky), active profiles with regular posts demonstrate business vitality. Customers see your latest posts when viewing your listing.
how_to_fix: Match or exceed competitor posting frequency
Minimum: 1 post per week
Include photos and CTAs in every post
Plan posts using a content calendar
